New Records: West Indies won the match by 9 wickets with 17 balls remaining
Jason Holder was named Player of the Match
Jason Holder took 4 wickets and scored 76.97 points as MVP
Key Match Events: England was all out for 103 runs in 19.4 overs

Fall of wickets: 1-6 (Jason Roy), 2-10 (Tom Banton), 3-10 (Moeen Ali), 4-24 (James Vince), 5-29 (Sam Billings), 6-39 (Liam Dawson), 7-49 (Eoin Morgan), 8-85 (Chris Jordan), 9-103 (Saqib Mahmood), 10-103 (Adil Rashid
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies elected to field first after winning the toss
England had a powerplay score of 26 runs in 6 overs with 4 wickets
West Indies scored 37 runs in their powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies led the series 1-0 after the first match
Jason Holder reflected on the victory
Match referee Richie Richardson praised the performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 1st T20I of the series
The match was played at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown
Umpires included Gregory Brathwaite, Joel Wilson, and Richie Richardson
